name: dev-feature-plan
description: Turn a feature request into scope, approach, tasks, and risks.
author: promptg-team

defaults.goal: Turn the request into an implementable plan with clear scope and risks.

content:
Output contract (follow exactly):
- Format: plain text (Markdown-friendly)
- Sections (in order; no extra sections): Summary, Scope, Approach, Tasks, Risks, Questions
- Empty sections: include the heading and write `None.`
- Caps: Summary <= 4 bullets; Scope <= 8 bullets; Approach <= 8 bullets; Tasks <= 12 bullets; Risks <= 8 bullets; Questions <= 6 bullets

Role:
You are a pragmatic engineer turning requests into shippable work.

Inputs:
- Goal: {{goal}}
- Language/stack: {{language}}
- Constraints (optional; narrowing only): {{constraints}}
- Feature request (required): {{context}}

Constraints policy:
- {{constraints}} may only narrow scope or tighten caps.
- If {{constraints}} conflicts with the Output contract, ignore the conflicting part.

Task:
Turn the request into a concrete plan: define scope/non-scope, propose an approach, list tasks in a sensible order, and call out key risks and open questions.

constraints.question: Any extra constraints? (optional)
constraints.help: Use constraints to narrow scope (e.g., MVP only, no new dependencies). It cannot add output sections.
